Additional Scope Comments: All agency email in all agency email accounts will be managed using GRS 6.1 items 010 and 011. The agency will be using item 012
Transfer Instructions: Transfer to NARA 15 years after cutoff.
Legacy Email Scope: The capstone approach will be applied to all legacy email starting in 2011 when USDA and its components implemented ProofPoint. Prior to 2011, USDA employed a print and file policy to email.  Extant legacy email prior to 2011 is inaccessible and will be scheduled for disposal on a separate Request for Records Disposition Authority.

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Export-Import Bank of the United States
Additional Scope Comments: Cut off at the end of the calendar year and transfer to NARA in 5 year blocks when most recent record in the block is 15 years old.
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including electronic email for the Chairman James H. Lambright 2006-2009 and electronic email for the Chairman Fred Hochberg 2009-present.  Other permanent record e-mail from the time period predating 2014 is in paper format, as traditional records management with a print-and-file policy was enforced prior to 2014 adoption of the media-neutral Records Schedule  DAA-0275-2015-0001 by the agency.
URL to Agency Organization Chart: http://eximconnect/sites/default/files/employee-resources/new-employees/ex-im_bank_organization_chart_2015_-_officers_and_managers_sept2015.pdfNOTE:  Agency has provided an updated organization chart that shows the current offices in the agency.  The agency uses its organization chart as it is more accurate than the Government Manual or Plum Book.

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau
Cutoff Instructions: Cut off in five-year blocks at the end of the calendar year.
Transfer Instructions: Transfer email records 15 years after the cutoff.
Legacy Email Scope: TTB will apply the Capstone approach to email records management (GRS 6.1) retrospectively to all available legacy email.  TTB has some permanent email from accounts that pre-date 2003 that were active at the time of re-organization, which originated with TTB's predecessor organization within the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF).  Email from accounts inactive at the time of re-organization were not transferred to TTB.  ATF is responsible for managing these records.  Also, pre-dated 2003 printed email records are maintained in respective industry/case file disposed as per record schedule.

Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Department of State, Foreign Service Posts
Additional Scope Comments: 1.  The Department may decide to use item 012 in the future and will submit a new form at that time.2.  Scope of RG 084 is for overseas posts only.  General State Department records are in RG 059.3.  Cutoff and transfer instructions for GRS 6.1, item 10 - Cut off at the end of tenure. Transfer to the National Archives 25 years after cutoff.
Legacy Email Scope: The Department will be applying GRS 6.1 item 010 and item 011 beginning on December 31, 2016 and continuing day forward for all emails. Pursuant to question 22, section A in the aforementioned FAQ guidance, the Department will also be using GRS 23, item 7 as part of its culling strategy. The Department will be applying GRS 6.1, item 010 to any existing legacy senior official’s emails, including its email collection that was previously maintained on disc commonly referred to as Cable Archive Retrieval System. This reflects the Department’s effort to ensure as much permanently valuable email will be transferred to NARA as possible. The Department will not be applying GRS 6.1, item 011 or item 012 for temporary legacy emails created before December 31, 2016. The Department will be applying its other approved disposition authorities for these records pursuant to question 22, section B in the aforementioned FAQ.  Please note, the Department routinely communicated with its employees concerning their records management responsibilities through Cables and Department Notices which required each employee to print-and-file and/or cross-file email records.
